meanings.definition: A drink taken before a meal as an appetizer.
meanings.sent1: The prelibation of a small glass of juice whetted his appetite for dinner.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed a prelibation of sparkling water before the main course.
meanings.sent3: The prelibation of a fruity mocktail made her feel like a fancy diner.
meanings.sent4: The prelibation of a warm cup of tea was like a hug for her taste buds.
meanings.sent5: The prelibation of a cold lemonade was a refreshing start to the evening.

meanings.definition: The act of drinking before a meal.
meanings.sent1: His prelibation of water before dinner helped him stay hydrated.
meanings.sent2: The tradition of prelibation is common in many cultures around the world.
meanings.sent3: Their prelibation of soda before the feast made them giggle uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The prelibation of a toast to good health set a positive tone for the meal.
meanings.sent5: The prelibation of a sip of wine added a touch of elegance to the evening.
